thread.title: Show us what you have, Rahman Dahlan challenges Sabah opposition
thread.title_full: Show us what you have, Rahman Dahlan challenges Sabah opposition - Nation | The Star Online

author: thestar.com.my
title: Show us what you have, Rahman Dahlan challenges Sabah opposition
text:
KOTA BELUD: Sabah Barisan Nasional secretary Datuk Seri Abdul Rahman Dahlan has challenged opposition parties in the state to present better economic, social, education and security policies if they want to change the ruling government.
Abdul Rahman, who is also Minister in the Prime Minsiter's Department and Kota Belud MP, said such policies will serve as a guide for the people to make informed decisions on the government they want to elect in the next election.
"I want to tell the people of Sabah, to my knowledge, hearing statements from the opposition, none are about policies whether economic, social, education or security. What we know is that they want to govern the state without telling us what their policies are.
"Everyone knows BN's education and economic policies, but what of the opposition? So, how will the people vote for them if they do not know what their policies are.
"What is now touted by the opposition is that their leaders are ready to be prime minister or chief minister. These are very important posts," he told reporters after attending an ang pow festival organised by SJK(C) Chung Hwa Saturday night.
Abdul Rahman expressed his disappointment that the opposition parties use approaches that are seditious and slanderous and vilify their political opponents to gain the people's support instead of offering better policies than Barisan.
"I want to tell the opposition, if they want to capture the hearts of the people of Sabah, they need to come up with the announcement of better economic, social, security and education policies.
"As a BN leader, I will review their policies. Then we will be in a healthy political situation. Only then can we develop the nation," he said.
Abdul Rahman said the opposition will be rejected if it only comes up with rhetoric to change the government and leaders without policies. - Bernama
